face_recognizer.src.back package¶

Submodules¶

face_recognizer.src.back.build_model module¶

This module contains all the functions used to build and train a deep learning model capable of identifying people’s faces. Transfert learning has been used to increase the model’s performances. The dataset used for training the models is VGGFace2. However, VGGFace2 has become the name to refer to the pre-trained models which has been trained on the dataset. ResNet50 architecture is used to train the model.

Pre-processes the images before feeding them into the model.

Parameters

  • model_name – name of the model.

  • verbose – Is True, plots the training history

face_recognizer.src.back.faceRecognizer module¶

face_recognizer.src.back.faceRecognizer.main(model_saving_path, classes)[source]¶

Sets up and Starts the final application.

Parameters

  • model_saving_path (str) – path to the model’s parameters. At this stage, the model is already trained and is able to recognize faces.

  • classes (list(str)) – names of the persons the model should recognize.

face_recognizer.src.back.face_recognition module¶

This module contains functions used to detect faces in an image. Faces are detected using MTCNN .

face_recognizer.src.back.face_recognition.faces_detector(img_path, detector, img_size=(224, 224), threshold_confidence=0.9)[source]¶

Detects faces in an image, using MTCNN.

Parameters

  • img_path (str) – path to the image of interest.

  • detector (MTCNN instance) – detector to use to detect faces

  • img_size (tuple(int, int)) – desired size of image

  • threshold_confidence (float) – threshold to decide whether a detection is considered as a face or not.

face_recognizer.src.back.generate_train_validation_test_sets module¶

Bases: object

clearDirectoryBeforeBuildingDatasets()[source]¶

Clears self.parent_directory

generateDatasets(classes, training_set_size, validation_set_size, testing_set_size, critial_samples_number_in_smallest_class)[source]¶

Generates/Builds training, validation and test sets used for training the model.

Parameters

  • classes (list(str)) – all classes of the classifier. In other words, all labels i.e. subdirectories we want in each dataset.

  • training_set_size (int) – number of samples in the training set

  • validation_set_size (int) – number of samples in the validation set

  • testing_set_size (int) – number of samples in the test set

  • critial_samples_number_in_smallest_class (int) – If all classes have not the same number of samples, the user have to precise the minimum amount of samples contained in the smallest class.

face_recognizer.src.back.utils.find_all_faces_in_multiple_img(img_dir_path, detector, img_size, dst_path)[source]¶

Finds all faces contained in several images (contained in a given directory). The detected images are then saved in dst_path.

Parameters

  • img_dir_path (str) – path of the directory containing all images of interest.

  • detector (MTCNN instance.) – method to use for detecting images.

  • img_size (tuple(int, int)) – Desired size of images.

  • dst_path (str) – destination path. Folder containing the faces found.

Note

All images must have been renamed with respect to the convention set in the function ‘rename_multiple_file’ (e.g: ‘name_000i.jpg’) The function finds faces ONLY from the image indexed len(dst_path). This allows the user to add more when he desired without finding faces in ALL images everytime. The function will focus on new data only. If len(dst_path) == 0 (no old data found) the function will still work.

face_recognizer.src.back.utils.find_all_faces_in_one_img(img_path, detector, img_size, dst_path)[source]¶

Finds all faces contained in one image. The detected images are then saved in dst_path.

Parameters

  • img_path (str) – path of the image of interest.

  • detector (MTCNN instance.) – method to use for detecting images.

  • img_size (tuple(int, int)) – Desired size of images.

  • dst_path (str) – destination path. Folder containing the faces found.

face_recognizer.src.back.utils.rename_multiple_files(dir_path, obj)[source]¶

Renames files contained in dir_path according to the convention <name_0001.extension>.

Parameters

  • dir_path (str) – path to the directory

  • obj (str) – Prefix to be added to each file. For ex. car, bike, flower …

face_recognizer.src.back.utils.resize_multiple_images(src_path, dst_path, img_size=None)[source]¶

Resizes all images of src_path into img_size shape and save them in dst_path.

Parameters

  • src_path (str) – source path. Folder containing raw images to be resized.

  • dst_path (str) – destination path. Folder containing the resized images. It must exists before calling the function.

  • img_size (tuple(int, int)) – Desired size of images.

Note

When src_path and dst_path are the same, images are overwritten

face_recognizer.src.back.utils.set_datasets_sizes(list_of_sizes)[source]¶
Splits all data into training, validation and test sets as follows:

-> 70% in training -> 20% in validation -> 10% in test

param list_of_sizes

list containing all sizes of all classes of interests.

type list_of_sizes

str
